title: PM-2.5 from powerplants causes respiratory disease

content.question: Recent studies have found that fine particulate matter with a diameter of 2.5 Î¼m or less can have negative human health effects. Which of the following correctly links a negative human health effect to an anthropogenic source of fine particulate matter?

choices.label: High rates of respiratory disease from power plant emissions
High rates of skin cancer in urban areas with sewage treatment plants
High rates of asthma from salt spray in coastal communities
High rates of genetic deformities from additives in food supplies
High rates of obesity from exposure to waste from meatpacking

content.answer: High rates of respiratory disease from power plant emissions
